timeline.bodyText: We have a constant in Lifecycle.java with lower case "requiresPrivilege". However, actual deployment config has upper case.
timeline.author: tilo-chen

replies.bodyText: It is case insensitive. Use the constant.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Unfortunately if the case don't match, this comparison fails and it still restarts: https://github.com/aws/aws-greengrass-nucleus/blob/master/src/main/java/com/aws/greengrass/lifecyclemanager/GenericExternalService.java#L239
replies.author: tilo-chen

replies.bodyText: Since it is case insensitive, change the value of the const to be PascalCase

timeline.bodyText: why are we setting these heap values?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: This jvm option is getting deployed in UAT. And it's in this (default?) recipe https://github.com/aws/aws-greengrass-nucleus/blob/master/aws.greengrass.Nucleus.yaml
replies.author: tilo-chen

replies.bodyText: That shouldn't be in the recipe. That should come from the configuration of the service and not by default
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I think Tilo did this because the recipe has defaults for these right now and in deployments if no values are set for these then the defaults will be used. If these are not the right defaults or should not have default values at all they should be removed from the recipe and the correct value in use at the time of launch should be used here. @hui-yang Can you comment on this?

replies.bodyText: This seems correct to me for the default value in recipe. But is it possible to get the actual settings from the current JVM?

timeline.bodyText: If we initialize with these options, which is definitely right, do we still need defaults in the recipe? Won't the next deployment try to reevaluate the bootstrap script topic with those defaults and restart if they're different from what you get here?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: If that is a problem, should we also add the jvmOptions configuration topic with these values that actually gets used during launch?
replies.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText:
Yeah if we already launched it with the default jvmOptions (maybe when the user copies the install command from cloud console or via other methods), then no need to put it in recipe unless we intend to change it. As long as we're consistent it shouldn't cause unexpected restart.
BTW jvmOptions is not in DeviceConfigurations right now. This needs to be added right?
replies.author: tilo-chen

replies.bodyText: If you make a nucleus component deployment and have a value for this config (default or set by customer) it will end up creating a topic under services:aws.greengrass.Nucleus:configuration: anyway, so I don't see any harm in adding it, we probably don't need any getters etc because we don't need them anywhere else in the code
replies.author: shaguptashaikh
